<title level="1" right="Rules">[Animal Companions](/Rules.aspx?ID=149)</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 214 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">
An animal companion is a loyal comrade who follows your orders. Your animal companion has the [animal](/Traits.aspx?ID=9) and [minion](/Traits.aspx?ID=109) traits, and it gains 2 actions during your turn if you use the Command an Animal action to command it; this is in place of the usual effects of Command an Animal, and you don't need to attempt a Nature check. If your companion dies, you can spend a week of downtime to replace it at no cost. You can have only one animal companion at a time.

A list of available animal companions can be found [here](/animal-companions).
</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>
